NMdata 0.0.5.4

    • Automated and general reader of Nonmem data
  • Changelog

Extract columns that do not vary within variables in a data.frame

findCovs.Rd

Extract columns that do not vary within variables in a data.frame

findCovs(data, cols.id = NULL, as.fun = NULL)

Arguments

data

data.frame in which to look for covariates
cols.id

covariates will be searched for in combinations of values in these columns. Often cols.id will be either empty or ID. But it can also be both say c("ID","DRUG") or c("ID","TRT").
as.fun

The default is to return data in data.tables. Pass a function in as.fun to convert to something else. If data.frames are wanted, use as.fun=as.data.frame.

See also

Other DataWrangling: NMorderColumns(), NMscanData(), findVars(), mergeCheck(), tmpcol()

Examples

dat <- NMscanData(NMdata_filepath("examples/nonmem/xgxr001.lst"))

#> Number of output tables read: 1.
#> Read delimited text input data file.
#> 
#> Input data columns will be appended to output data. However, column(s) were identified as unique identifiers, present in both input and output data. If this column or one of these columns is not modified by the Nonmem run, consider using this in col.row for a robust merge of input and output data. Candidate columns: ROW
#> To skip this check, please specify either col.row (recommended) or cbind.by.filters.
### very common use
findCovs(dat,cols.id="ID")

### Without an ID column we get non-varying columns
findCovs(dat)

#>       TVKA  TVV2    TVCL    TVV3     TVQ      V3       Q nmout BLQ CYCLE FLAG
#> 1: 0.18116 0.042 0.72491 0.17857 8813700 0.17857 8813700  TRUE   0     1    0
#>    PART PROFDAY STUDY TIMEUNIT         flag   model
#> 1:    1       1     1    Hours Analysis set xgxr001
